courses.name: Introduction to Music in the United States
courses.description: Historical overview of American folk, popular, and fine-art music; emphasis on listening skills.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed

courses.name: History of Western Music I
courses.description: Historical survey of selected European practices up to 1700 following a consideration of the major fine-art traditions of the world.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 1322

courses.name: History of Western Music II
courses.description: Historical survey of Western fine-art music from approximately 1700 to the present.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2307

courses.name: Historical Studies in Art Song
courses.description: Historical survey of works for solo voice and instruments.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in  MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in Art Song - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Historical survey of works for solo voice and instruments.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in  MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in Choral Music
courses.description: Historical survey of works featuring choral ensembles.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in Choral Music - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Historical survey of works featuring choral ensembles.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in Opera
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_H_LI 7313).  Historical survey of opera.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in  MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in Opera - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Historical survey of opera.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in  MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in Large Ensemble Music
courses.description: Historical survey of works for large instrumental ensembles.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in Chamber Music
courses.description: Historical survey of works for small ensembles, instrumental and vocal.

courses.name: Historical Studies in Chamber Music - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Historical survey of works for small ensembles, instrumental and vocal.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in Keyboard Music
courses.description: Historical survey of works for solo keyboard instruments.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in Jazz and Popular Music
courses.description: Historical survey of works from the realm of American jazz and popular music.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in Jazz and Popular Music - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Historical survey of works from the realm of American jazz and popular music.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Studies in World Music
courses.description: Advanced systematic study of musical activities in selected world cultures, with the emphasis on developing listening skills and understanding the role of music in a culture.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2307 and MUS_H_LI 2308

courses.name: Studies in World Music - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Advanced systematic study of musical activities in selected world cultures, with the emphasis on developing listening skills and understanding the role of music in a culture.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2307 and MUS_H_LI 2308

courses.name: Historical Studies in African-American Music
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_H_LI 7320). Exploration of history and current scholarship in African-American music from the eighteenth to twenty-first centuries. Genres include folk music, religious music, blues, ragtime, jazz, musical theater, art music, R&B, funk, soul, disco, house, hip-hop and rap.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and Instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in African-American Music - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Exploration of history and current scholarship in African-American music from the eighteenth to twenty-first centuries. Genres include folk music, religious music, blues, ragtime, jazz, musical theater, art music, R&B, funk, soul, disco, house, hip-hop and rap.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and Instructor's consent

courses.name: Music of the Postmodern Era
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_H_LI 7330). Systematic study of fine-art musical practice from approximately 1945 to the present.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308

courses.name: Music of the Middle Ages and the Renaissance
courses.description: Systematic study of European musical practice before 1600.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Music in the Baroque Era
courses.description: Systematic study of European musical practice from approximately 1600 to 1750.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Music of the Classic Era
courses.description: Systematic study of European musical practice from approximately 1750 to 1800.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in  MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Music of the Classic Era - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Systematic study of European musical practice from approximately 1750 to 1800.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in  MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Music of the Romantic Era
courses.description: Systematic study of European musical practice from approximately 1800 to 1900.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in  MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Music of the Modern Era
courses.description: Systematic study of fine-art musical practice from approximately 1900 to the present.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308

courses.name: Focal Composers
courses.description: Systematic study of the works of landmark composers: J.S. Bach, Mozart, Beethoven, Verdi/Wagner, Debussy, or Stravinsky, studied in rotation. Repeatable for up to 6 hours or credit.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Focal Composers - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Systematic study of the works of landmark composers: J.S. Bach, Mozart, Beethoven, Verdi/Wagner, Debussy, or Stravinsky, studied in rotation. Repeatable for up to 6 hours or credit.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Advanced Studies in American Music
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_H_LI 7341). Systematic study of the diverse streams of musical practice in the United States from the colonial time to the present.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in  MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Advanced Studies in American Music - Writing Intensive
courses.description: (cross-leveled with MUS_H_LI 7341). Systematic study of the diverse streams of musical practice in the United States from the colonial time to the present.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in  MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Contemporary Issues in Musicology
courses.description: Systematic study of single musicological problem of contemporary relevance.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2308 and instructor's consent

courses.name: Introduction to Ethnomusicology
courses.description: Study of theories, historical development, research methodologies, and practice of ethnomusicology, in an interdisciplinary approach.  Topics include ethnographic research, oral and literate sources, transcription and analysis, critical analysis, and interpretative techniques.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C-or better in MUS_H_LI 2308; instructor's consent

courses.name: Introduction to Ethnomusicology - Writing Intensive
courses.description: Study of theories, historical development, research methodologies, and practice of ethnomusicology, in an interdisciplinary approach.  Topics include ethnographic research, oral and literate sources, transcription and analysis, critical analysis, and interpretative techniques.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C-or better in MUS_H_LI 2308; instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in African Music
courses.description: (same as BL_STU 4352) Ethnomusicological introduction to the music and culture of countries and ethnic groups in Africa.  Traditional and contemporary popular styles are explored, and influences of Islamic invasions, missionary arrivals, colonial conquests, neo-colonial trends, and globalization.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C-or better in MUS_H_LI 2308; instructor's consent

courses.name: Historical Studies in African Music - Writing Intensive
courses.description: (same as BL_STU 4352) Ethnomusicological introduction to the music and culture of countries and ethnic groups in Africa.  Traditional and contemporary popular styles are explored, and influences of Islamic invasions, missionary arrivals, colonial conquests, neo-colonial trends, and globalization.
courses.prerequisites: grade of C-or better in MUS_H_LI 2308; instructor's consent

courses.name: American Musicals
courses.description: (same as THEATR 4720). Historical survey of the development of the 20th-Century American Musical in Theatre and Film.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed

courses.name: Honors in Music History I
courses.description: Special readings, directed research for graduation with Honors in music history.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 2307 and MUS_H_LI 2308

courses.name: Honors in Music History II
courses.description: Continuation of MUS_H_LI 4397 leading to Honors thesis in music history.
courses.prerequisites: Grade of C- or better in MUS_H_LI 4397

courses.name: Graduate History Review
courses.description: Review of history for graduate students. Does not fulfill graduate degree requirements. Graded on S/U basis only.
courses.prerequisites: instructor's consent

courses.name: Graduate Review of Music History I
courses.description: Survey of the history of Western music from ca. 600 A.D. to ca. 1750. Special readings; individual projects.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed

courses.name: Graduate Review of Music History II
courses.description: Survey of the history of Western music from ca. 1750 to the present. Special readings; individual projects.
courses.prerequisites: None Listed
